Sentencas: This work investigates the catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ anodes as electrodes of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs) to be operated under direct dry reforming of methane.
Titulo: Optimization of dry reforming of methane over Ni/YSZ anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The experimental test rig consists of a micro-reactor, where anode samples are characterized.
Titulo: Optimization of dry reforming of methane over Ni/YSZ anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The gas composition at the reactor outlet is monitored using a mass spectrometer.
Titulo: Optimization of dry reforming of methane over Ni/YSZ anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The kinetics of the reactions occurring over the anode is investigated by means of Isotherm reactions and Temperature-programmed reactions.
Titulo: Optimization of dry reforming of methane over Ni/YSZ anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The effect of the variation of temperature, gas residence time and inlet carbon dioxide-methane volumetric ratio is analyzed.
Titulo: Optimization of dry reforming of methane over Ni/YSZ anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At 800 degrees C, the best catalytic performance (in the carbon safe region) is obtained for 1.5 < carbon dioxide/methane ratio <2, which is an interesting result for prospective direct biogas fueled SOFCs.
Titulo: Optimization of dry reforming of methane over Ni/YSZ anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Conversion is stable over a period of 70 h. Both for temperatures lower than 450 degrees C and for carbon dioxide methane ratios lower than equi-molar at 800 degrees C, conversion is poor due to low activity of the anode toward dry reforming and cracking reactions, respectively.
Titulo: Optimization of dry reforming of methane over Ni/YSZ anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In other ranges, dry reforming and reverse water gas shift are the dominant reactions and the inlet feed reaches almost the equilibrium condition provided that a sufficient gas residence time is obtained.
Titulo: Optimization of dry reforming of methane over Ni/YSZ anodes for solid oxide fuel cells
